item.title: Lift Your Heart
item.description:
The road was misty, dull and dark,
No one was there to lift my heart.
I’m all alone in that scary way,
The road less travelled is what they say.

Was I too brave to take a try?
On the road less travelled by.
Was I too strong to face the rocks?
I want a chance to turn the clocks.

If the choice was wrong, you make it right,
Face the rocks be brave and fight.
You know you can, you know you will,
Lift your heart, you can’t stand still.

You were sane when you went ahead,
You had a thought, believe in that.
The thought was deep but wasn’t hollow,
Make the road for others to follow.

item.title: Step Aside From The Race
item.description:
This is one of my first poems and my personal favourite.


Step aside from the race to think.
Relax and realize the purpose of the race
Think from an unconditioned perspective
Are we here to survive?

Why are we so desperate to keep the world moving?
Are we merely players in The Big Drama?
Being watched by an unknown audience
And we humans playing the role of fools and jokers
In the more sensible world around us.

Is this life a gift or a trap?
With luxuries merely the baits,
To catch the innocent beings
In this illusionary and deceiving world.

Think again before you rejoin the race

I rejoin the ‘Race’ once more
Would think about it another day…
